items.title: WhatsApp will soon limit number of broadcast messages users and businesses can send
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- WhatsApp will limit the number of broadcast messages that users and businesses can send to reduce spam.
- Testing will begin soon, with a suggested limit of 30 messages per month for individual users.
- Business accounts will see the introduction of a paid version for broadcast messaging, previously unlimited.
- Merchants will be able to send customized broadcast messages and schedule them, with 250 free messages available during the pilot.
- The changes aim to help users receive fewer overwhelming messages while still allowing businesses to communicate effectively.
- WhatsApp Business has become an important revenue source for Meta, with the new limits introducing a potential additional revenue stream for the company.

items.title: Exist is a new social wellness app that wants to help middle-age users find community
items.author: Jason Jardim, Alicia Waldner
items.summary:
- Exist is an iOS social wellness app aimed at helping middle-aged users connect and build communities.
- The app features social journaling, daily mood tracking, audio exercises, and guided meditations.
- Founded by Jason Jardim and Alicia Waldner, it originally targeted Gen Z but shifted focus to middle-aged users as the average sign-up age became 40.
- Exist includes a TikTok-like feed for sharing journal entries and receiving community responses.
- Offers a free community journaling experience, with a subscription option for additional features at $5.99 per month.
- Future plans include enhancing human connection, adding sleep habit tracking, and personalized journal prompts.

items.title: Google plans to release new ‘open’ AI models for drug discovery
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Google announced the development of new open AI models called TxGemma for drug discovery at a health-focused event in New York.
- The models will be released through its Health AI Developer Foundations program later this month.
- TxGemma can analyze both text and the structures of therapeutic entities, aiding researchers in predicting properties of new therapies.
- There is no clarification yet on whether the models will allow for commercial use or customization.
- The move follows a trend where many companies are investing in AI for drug research but face challenges in clinical trial success.
- Over 460 AI startups are working on drug discovery, with $60 billion invested in the space so far.

items.title: Google launches new healthcare-related features for Search, Android
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
• Google announced new healthcare-related features for Search, including expanded knowledge panels for health queries.
• A new mobile feature called 'What People Suggest' highlights user-generated content about health conditions.
• Google launched new medical records APIs globally for its Health Connect platform to streamline health data access.
• The Pixel Watch 3 will introduce a 'Loss of Pulse Detection' feature by the end of March, pending FDA clearance.
• Google is set to release new open AI models for drug discovery named TxGemma in the coming weeks.

items.title: TurinTech reveals $20M in backing to fix problems in ‘vibe coding’
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- TurinTech has raised $20 million to launch its Artemis product at NVIDIA’s GTC event.
- Artemis is an ‘evolutionary AI’ platform aimed at optimizing and validating enterprise codebases, addressing inefficiencies in AI-generated code.
- The funding includes a $15 million Series A, led by Oxford Capital, with previous seed funding of $5 million.
- AI-generated code is predicted to transform software development, with Gartner projecting that 75% of enterprise software engineers will use AI code assistants by 2028.

items.title: Apple loses appeal against Germany’s special abuse control for Big Tech
items.summary:
- Apple has lost an appeal regarding Germany’s special abuse control regime enforced by the competition watchdog.
- The ruling by Germany’s Federal Court of Justice maintains the five-year regulatory designation on Apple initiated in April 2023.
- The special abuse controls aim to ensure fair competition against major digital companies, including Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft.
- Apple disputes the court's decision, asserting that it operates in a competitive environment and emphasizes its commitment to user privacy.

items.title: Google is buying Wiz for $33B to beef up in cloud security, sources say
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Google is acquiring cloud security startup Wiz for $33 billion, marking its largest acquisition to date.
- The deal awaits regulatory approval; neither Google nor Wiz has confirmed it officially yet.
- The acquisition is aimed at enhancing Google's position in enterprise cloud and security sectors, where it currently lags behind competitors like AWS and Microsoft Azure.
- Previous acquisition talks at a $23 billion valuation fell apart due to antitrust concerns and issues related to Wiz's autonomy.
- Wiz's business is growing rapidly, with an ARR projected to reach $1 billion this year after surpassing $500 million last year.

items.title: Nerdio nabs $500M to power virtual desktops on Azure
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- Nerdio raises $500 million in Series C funding to enhance Microsoft cloud technology management.
- Valuation has more than quadrupled since Series B, now estimated above $1 billion.
- The company targets optimization of cloud infrastructure and costs for enterprises.
- Investors include General Atlantic, Lead Edge Capital, and Stepstone, with the founders retaining a significant stake.
- Plans to expand product offerings and workforce of currently 300 employees to support growth.

items.title: YC-backed food supply startup Vendease restructures employees’ salaries
items.summary:
- Vendease, a Y Combinator-backed Nigerian food procurement startup, has changed its pay structure to a performance-based system after laying off 44% of its workforce.
- The new compensation model includes a five-phase salary recovery plan, aiming for full salary restoration by December 2025 based on performance targets.
- Vendease is seeking fresh capital and aims to become profitable by leveraging its software-driven operations and a buy now, pay later (BNPL) product to support food businesses.

items.title: GrubMarket raises $50M at a $3.5B+ valuation to build AI for the $1 trillion food distribution industry
items.summary:
- GrubMarket secured $50 million in a Series G funding round, boosting its valuation to over $3.5 billion.
- Major investors include Liberty Street Funds, 3Spoke Capital, and others, with a focus on technology improvements, especially in AI.
- The company anticipates $2.4 billion in revenue for 2025, up from $2 billion in 2024, and is profitable on an EBITDA basis.
- GrubMarket plans acquisitions to enhance its food distribution capabilities and has expanded its presence to 70 countries.

items.title: Google, Speedinvest back Kenya’s Leta, which uses AI to make logistics cheaper
items.summary:
- African businesses pay up to four times the global average to transport goods, driving up prices for essentials.
- Nairobi-based Leta uses AI for optimizing delivery routes, tracking shipments, and streamlining payments.
- Leta raised $5 million in seed funding led by Speedinvest, backed by Google’s Africa Investment Fund.
- The startup aims to help businesses move goods cheaper and faster across Kenya, Nigeria, Uganda, Zambia and Zimbabwe.
- Its platform can automate manifest creation and dynamically optimize delivery routes in real-time.
- Leta has seen growth from 500,000 deliveries to 4.5 million, increasing its revenue fivefold since last coverage.

items.title: Waymo’s milestone SFO mapping permit comes with strings attached
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary:
- Waymo has received a temporary permit to map roadways at San Francisco International Airport, starting from March 14.
- Employees will manually drive Waymo vehicles for mapping; this is the first step toward commercial operations.
- The permit includes a data-sharing agreement requiring Waymo to provide specific data after mapping sessions
- Waymo is prohibited from using autonomous vehicles for moving commercial goods; this aligns with past efforts to ensure job safety and community impact.
- The temporary permit comes after Waymo's failed attempt to secure mapping rights in 2023 and requires a subsequent approval to operate commercially at SFO.

items.title: Google revives talks to acquire Wiz at higher valuation
items.author: Marina Temkin, Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Google’s parent company Alphabet is in advanced talks to acquire Wiz at a higher valuation of around $30 billion.
- The previous deal talks were at a $23 billion valuation but fell through.
- Wiz, a cloud cybersecurity startup, has annual recurring revenue of $500 million and aims for $1 billion by 2025.
- The deal is complicated by whether Wiz will remain a separate division or be integrated into Google Cloud.
- Regulatory scrutiny under the Biden administration previously contributed to the breakdown of talks.
- Wiz was founded in 2020 by former Israeli military officers and has significant backers including Andreessen Horowitz and Sequoia.

items.title: OpenAI exec leaves to found materials science startup
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Liam Fedus, VP of research for post-training at OpenAI, is leaving to start a materials science AI company.
- Fedus stated that AI for science is strategically important for OpenAI, which plans to invest in and partner with his new venture.
- His startup will compete with major players like Google DeepMind and Microsoft in the AI materials science field.

items.title: Intel could be in for significant changes as Lip-Bu Tan takes on CEO role
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Lip-Bu Tan has been appointed as Intel's new CEO, announced last week.
- He aims to implement significant changes in chip manufacturing and AI strategies.
- Potential actions include cutting middle management and revamping manufacturing approaches.
- Tan has warned of making 'tough decisions' to improve the struggling company.
- He rejoined Intel after leaving the board in August 2024 due to disagreements with former CEO Pat Gelsinger.

items.title: Rippling sues Deel, Deel denies ‘all legal wrongdoing’, and Slack is the main witness
items.summary:
- HR company Rippling has filed a lawsuit against rival Deel, accusing it of racketeering and trade secret misappropriation.
- Deel denies all allegations, claiming Rippling is shifting the narrative after being accused of violating sanctions law in Russia.
- The lawsuit highlights employee D.S.'s suspicious Slack activity, allegedly accessing confidential information related to Deel multiple times.
- Rippling claims it created a fake Slack channel to confirm suspicions about D.S.’s behavior.
- The lawsuit details an incident where D.S. allegedly attempted to hide evidence by fleeing into a bathroom and flushing his phone down the toilet.

items.title: How to stop doomscrolling
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- The pervasive nature of smartphones promotes doomscrolling, impacting mental health.
- Recognizing that tech companies design apps to capture user attention can help break the habit.
- Setting up screen time limits can reduce usage; options include Apple’s built-in features and third-party apps like [ScreenZen](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/screenzen-screen-time-control/id1541027222?platform=iphone) and [Opal](https://techcrunch.com/2022/09/15/opal-revamps-its-screen-time-app-to-help-anyone-not-just-parents-with-kids-focus-and-avoid-distractions/).
- Suggestions to replace scrolling include reading e-books via [Libby](https://libbyapp.com/) and playing games.

items.title: This app limits your screen time by making you literally touch grass
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- Developer Rhys Kentish launched the iOS app [Touch Grass](https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/touch-grass-reduce-screentime/id6739589530?ign-itscg=30200&ign-itsct=apps_box_badge&mttnsubad=6739589530) to lock distracting apps until users take a photo of actual grass.
- The app requires users to physically go outside, preventing the use of house plants as substitutes.
- Users can lock two apps for free, but can pay to unlock additional apps; half the payment goes to [rewilding efforts](https://www.rewildingbritain.org.uk/) in the U.K.
- The app has been downloaded around 50,000 times since its launch on March 17, 2025.

items.title: A Google-backed weapon to battle wildfires made it into orbit
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- The first satellite of the FireSat constellation successfully made it to orbit on March 14, 2025.
- The constellation aims to improve wildfire detection with over 50 satellites imaging Earth's surface every 20 minutes when fully operational.
- The first satellite was launched by SpaceX and equipped with six-band multispectral infrared cameras.
- FireSat provides five-meter resolution imagery and near real-time updates on wildfires, solving issues with current tracking methods.
- The project is a collaboration between Muon Space and the Earth Fire Alliance, which includes support from Google and other foundations.

items.title: These fintech companies are hiring in 2025 after a turbulent year
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- The fintech sector experienced significant growth during the pandemic but faced challenges in 2024, including the shutdown of accounting startup Bench.
- Despite a slowdown in funding, many fintech firms are still hiring, with some companies opening even more roles than in previous months.
- Various fintech companies are listed with their available job openings, serving as a resource for those seeking employment in the industry.

items.title: People are using Google’s new AI model to remove watermarks from images
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Users are exploiting Google’s Gemini AI model to remove watermarks from images, including those from Getty Images.
- Gemini 2.0 Flash’s image generation feature allows it to create and edit content, but lacks effective guardrails.
- The model can fill in gaps left by removed watermarks, which has raised copyright concerns.
- This capability is labeled experimental and not intended for production use, yet some copyright holders might take issue with its unrestricted use.
- Removing watermarks without consent is illegal under U.S. copyright law.

items.title: Flexport accuses former employees of stealing its source code to create a rival startup
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Flexport is suing former employees Yingwei Zhao and Bryan Lacaillade for allegedly stealing its source code and documents to form their startup Freightmate AI.
- Zhao is accused of downloading over 70,000 confidential Flexport documents and copying customer lists using Incognito Mode.
- Freightmate admitted to having some files but claimed they were retained inadvertently and not used.
- Flexport seeks unspecified damages and an injunction against the use of the allegedly stolen data.

items.title: Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, acquires a generative AI video startup
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, has acquired Hotshot, a startup focusing on AI-powered video generation tools.
- Hotshot's CEO, Aakash Sastry, announced the acquisition via a post on X.
- The startup had developed three video foundation models over the past 2 years: Hotshot-XL, Hotshot Act One, and Hotshot.
- Hotshot was initially centered on AI-powered photo tools before pivoting to text-to-video models.
- The acquisition might lead to xAI developing competitive video generation models against Sora and Google’s Veo 2.
- Hotshot had previously received investments from notable VCs but undisclosed its funding rounds.
- Customers have until March 30 to download videos created using Hotshot, which began sunsetting new video creation on March 14.

items.title: OpenAI to start testing ChatGPT connectors for Google Drive and Slack
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI is beta testing a feature called ChatGPT Connectors for business customers.
- The feature will enable integration with Google Drive and Slack for enhanced responses based on internal data.
- Future expansions to include platforms like Microsoft SharePoint and Box are planned.
- ChatGPT Connectors aims to facilitate use of internal knowledge similarly to web search.
- Concerns exist about ChatGPT accessing sensitive information; some businesses are cautious, while others are supportive.
- The connectors will sync encrypted copies of company files with ChatGPT, while maintaining strict adherence to user access permissions.
- Limitations include inability to analyze certain data types and restrictions on accessing private Slack messages.
- Companies interested in beta testing must provide 100 documents which will not be used for training but may help in synthetic data creation.

items.title: Klarna nabs Walmart away from Affirm and boosts its IPO prospects
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Klarna has announced a partnership to provide buy now, pay later loans for Walmart, taking over from Affirm.
- Klarna will implement the loan service through OnePay towards the end of this year.
- Affirm's stock fell 8% following the news, while Klarna's IPO filing indicates its recovery after a prior valuation drop.

items.title: YC-backed ReactWise is applying AI to speed up drug manufacturing
items.author: Alexander Pomberger, Daniel Wigh
items.summary:
- ReactWise, a YC-backed startup, is using AI to enhance chemical manufacturing, aiming to expedite drug production processes by 30 times.
- The firm plans to automate predictions for ideal experimental setups, potentially achieving this in two years.
- Founded in July 2024, ReactWise has secured $3.4 million in pre-seed funding and currently has 12 pilot trials with pharmaceutical companies, including some large players in the industry.

items.title: Google and Muon Space launch a new satellite to battle wildfires
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- The first satellite of the FireSat constellation successfully launched on March 14, 2025.
- This initiative aims to enhance wildfire detection and monitoring by providing updates every 20 minutes across Earth.
- The satellite features six-band multispectral infrared cameras designed for wildfire detection from a distance.
- The constellation is a collaborative effort involving Google, Muon Space, and the Earth Fire Alliance.

items.title: Texas man faces prison for activating ‘kill switch’ on former employer’s network
items.summary:
- Texas software developer Davis Lu faces up to 10 years in prison after being convicted of damaging his former employer’s network.
- Lu began sabotaging the systems after a corporate restructuring in 2018 reduced his responsibilities.
- He created a 'kill switch' that locked all employees out of the network when his credentials were deactivated, which activated upon his departure on September 9, 2019.
- The disruption affected thousands of employees and caused significant financial losses to the company.
- Sentencing is scheduled for June 23.

items.title: Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, allowed to leave France — despite ongoing criminal investigation
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram, allowed to leave France after modifying supervision conditions.
- Durov was arrested on August 24, 2024, over allegations of facilitating organized fraud and CSAM sharing.
- He initially had to pay €5 million bail and was barred from leaving France. These conditions have now changed.
- Investigation remains ongoing, and Durov still faces potential criminal trial in France.
- Telegram updated its policies post-arrest to enhance moderation and reporting of private chats.

items.title: TikTok rolls out a ‘Security Checkup’ tool to help users secure their accounts
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- TikTok introduces a new “Security Checkup” tool for users to review and update their account security settings.
- The tool can be accessed via “Settings and privacy” and “Security and permissions” from the user’s profile.
- It guides users through security features, encouraging them to enable enhanced security options like phone number linking and two-step verification.
- Users are reminded to check active devices and may enable biometric authentication for secure logins.
- TikTok monitors for unusual behavior, notifying users through the app.
- The rollout happens amidst ongoing uncertainty regarding TikTok's operation in the U.S. following a deadline extension to the app's ban by President Trump.

items.title: Hackers are exploiting Fortinet firewall bugs to plant ransomware
Nvidia GTC 2025: What to expect from this year’s show
How to watch Nvidia GTC 2025, including CEO Jensen Huang’s keynote
Bumble heightens safety measures with new ID verification feature
DOGE staffer violated Treasury rules by emailing unencrypted personal data
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- A DOGE staffer, Marko Elez, violated Treasury policies by sending unencrypted personal information in an email to two Trump administration officials before resigning in February.
- The security breach was revealed in a court filing by David Ambrose, treasury’s chief security and privacy officer, following an investigation into Elez's laptop and email account.
- Elez’s actions were deemed contrary to department policy, and the shared data included transaction details like names and amounts of money.

items.title: Travis Kalanick wants to do a lot more than develop more ghost kitchens
items.author: Connie Loizos
items.summary:
- Travis Kalanick shared his vision for CloudKitchens at the [Abundance Summit](http://abundance360.com/summit) in Los Angeles.
- Kalanick aims to evolve CloudKitchens from providing restaurant spaces to delivering AI-optimized meals directly to customers.
- He draws parallels between his business model and past industry disruptors like Uber and Zynga.
- Kalanick expressed concerns about restaurants relying on third-party platforms like Uber Eats and DoorDash.
- He emphasized the concept of cooking-as-a-service and the goal of making healthy meals universally accessible.
- AI's role in the future of food services was highlighted, emphasizing real-world applications beyond just digital interactions.
- Kalanick and fellow entrepreneur Marc Lore are targeting a future where AI enhances meal planning and health monitoring for consumers.
- Both CloudKitchens and Lore's venture Wonder have raised substantial investments, with Wonder acquiring GrubHub last November.

items.title: Vote for the session you want to see at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI will take place on June 5, 2025, at Zellerbach Hall, UC Berkeley.
- Voting for the Audience Choice speaker is open until March 21, 2025, at 11:59 PM PT.
- Six finalists include:
  - Cristina Mancini: "Who is Coding Our Future?"
  - Yann Stoneman: "Behind Your Firewall: Secure Generative AI for Regulated Enterprises"
  - Hua Wang: "The AI Policy Playbook: What Startups Need to Know"
  - Hardik Vasa: "Implementing Secure Generative AI with Guardrails"
  - Marcie Vu: "A Big Tech Banker-turned-Investor’s Unique Lens on Identifying Exceptional AI Founders"
  - Mahesh Chayel: "Guide to Monetizing Gen AI in Enterprise Applications"

items.title: Snap expands Spectacles capabilities with GPS and hand-tracking features
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Snap has launched new features for its Spectacles AR glasses including GPS and hand-tracking capabilities.
- Developers can now create Lenses using geo-location data and custom locations for enhanced location-based experiences.
- New applications like NavigatAR from Utopia Labs use Snap Map Tiles to assist users.
- Users can now also track hand gestures and see when they are holding a phone, adding to interaction possibilities.
- A leaderboard feature can be added for competitive Lenses, and a new AR keyboard is introduced.
- Spectacles are available through a $99/month developer program, with a 50% discount for educators and students.

items.title: TechCrunch All Stage unveils a powerhouse agenda for founders
items.summary:
- **Event Date**: July 15, 2025, in Boston.
- **Foundation Stage Topics**: Includes sessions on VC evaluations at Pre-Seed, MVP in AI, TAM Myth, and crafting pitch decks.
- **Scale Stage Introduction**: New full-day track focused on scaling from Series A and beyond, covering themes like sustainable companies and raising funds for Series C.
- **Speaker Format**: Unlike traditional events, speakers present expertise and answer audience questions; transcripts provided to all attendees.
- **Networking Opportunities**: Roundtable discussions and Braindate platform for mingling with founders and investors.

items.title: Palmetto wants software developers to electrify America using its AI building models
Roblox releases its open-source model that can create 3D objects using AI
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Roblox announced the launch of its 3D model named "Cube" that utilizes generative AI for creating 3D objects.
- An open-source version of Cube will be available for external developers to customize and build on.
- Cube features 3D mesh generation, allowing creators to generate objects like cars using simple prompts.
- Additional AI tools for Roblox include text generation, text-to-speech, and speech-to-text, with further developments planned.
- Future features aim to enhance complexity in mesh generation and scene creation, including dynamic seasonal changes in environments.

items.title: Discord launches SDK to help developers enhance social experiences in their games
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Discord launched the **Discord Social SDK**, a free toolkit for developers to enhance social and multiplayer experiences in games.
- The SDK features **integrated friends lists** allowing in-game access to Discord friends and vice versa.
- Includes **deep-linked game invites**, cross-platform messaging, and the ability to link in-game chats to Discord channels.
- Compatible with **C++, Unreal Engine, and Unity**; supports **Windows 11+ and macOS**, with plans for console and mobile support.
- Currently utilized by developers like **Tencent Games** and **Scopely**.
- Discord boasts **200 million monthly active users** who spend over **1.5 billion hours** playing games each month.

items.title: UK’s internet watchdog puts storage and file-sharing services on watch over CSAM
items.summary:
- The U.K.’s Online Safety Act (OSA) enforcement program launched on March 17, 2025.
- Ofcom's program focuses on file-sharing and file-storage services due to their susceptibility to sharing image-based child sexual abuse material (CSAM).
- Services have been notified to prepare for formal information requests regarding their safety measures against CSAM.
- Non-compliance with the OSA may result in penalties of up to 10% of global annual turnover.

items.title: Google adds its HD voice model Chirp 3 to its Vertex AI platform
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Google announced the addition of Chirp 3, an HD voice interface, to its Vertex AI platform, starting next week.
- Chirp 3 will include 8 new voices for 31 languages, aimed at creating voice assistants, audiobooks, and video voice-overs.
- The announcement was made at an event at Google’s DeepMind offices in London, amid competition from startups like Sesame.
- Usage restrictions will be implemented to prevent misuse, as stated by Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian.
- Google first launched Vertex AI in 2021 to facilitate cloud-based machine learning services, now competing with Microsoft and Amazon in generative AI.

items.title: Google beefs up its UK AI business with Agentspace data residency and more
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Google is expanding its AI operations in the U.K., announcing plans by CEO Demis Hassabis and Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian.
- The expansion includes UK data residency for Agentspace, allowing local hosting of AI services for enterprises.
- Up to £280,000 in Google Cloud credits and expanded AI skills training will be offered to startups joining the UK's new accelerator.
- Chirp 3, an audio generation model, will be added to the Vertex AI developer platform.
- Google aims to position itself as a primary partner for businesses looking to utilize AI, amidst concerns about data usage by Big Tech.
- The U.K. government is also promoting AI development, seeking to decrease reliance on non-local tech firms and enhance local AI initiatives.

items.title: European tech industry coalition calls for ‘radical action’ on digital sovereignty — starting with buying local
items.summary:
- A coalition of over 80 European tech organizations urges EU lawmakers for immediate action on digital sovereignty, focusing on local innovation.
- The letter advocates for a shift in public procurement policies to favor European digital solutions, including a 'Buy European' mandate.
- Companies like Airbus and Element support this initiative to reduce reliance on U.S. technology and ensure Europe's digital autonomy.
- The coalition warns of dire consequences if reliance on foreign tech continues, predicting accelerated loss of digital innovation in Europe.
- Recommendations include creating a Sovereign Infrastructure Fund and emphasizing the importance of pooling resources among European technologists.

items.title: Apple reportedly considered building the iPhone 17 Air without ports
items.summary:
- Apple is planning to launch the iPhone 17 Air in fall 2025, featuring a slimmer design and a combination of high-end and low-end features.
- The development of a skinnier phone involved significant engineering efforts, focusing on maximizing battery life with thinner batteries.
- Apple contemplated making the iPhone 17 Air completely port-free, relying on wireless charging and cloud-based data syncing, but decided against it due to regulatory concerns in Europe regarding USB-C support.

items.title: Meta takes aim at ex-employee’s memoir ‘Careless People’
items.author: Anthony Ha
items.summary:
- Meta won a legal victory against ex-employee Sarah Wynn-Williams, author of the memoir "Careless People."
- An arbitrator ruled Wynn-Williams may have violated a non-disparagement agreement.
- Despite the ruling, the book remains a bestseller on Amazon, potentially due to the "Streisand Effect."
- Macmillan, the publisher, supports the book and criticizes Meta's attempt to silence the author.
- Wynn-Williams claims her memoir offers insights into Facebook's operations and her experiences there from 2011 to 2017.
- Meta has dismissed the memoir as a mix of outdated claims and false accusations about executives.

items.title: People are using Google’s new AI model to remove watermarks from images
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Users are utilizing Google’s Gemini AI model to remove watermarks from images, including those from Getty Images.
- The Gemini 2.0 Flash model was recently expanded and features powerful image editing capabilities with few restrictions on usage.
- Some users report that Gemini can fill gaps left by watermarks but struggles with semi-transparent ones.
- The feature is labeled as experimental and not for production use; it may have legal implications regarding copyright laws.

items.title: Baidu launches two new versions of its AI model Ernie
items.summary:
- Baidu has launched two new AI models: Ernie 4.5 and the reasoning model Ernie X1 on March 16, 2025.
- Ernie 4.5 features high emotional intelligence (EQ) and can understand memes and satire, while Ernie X1 competes with DeepSeek R1 at a lower cost.
- Both models have multimodal capabilities, processing video, images, audio, and text.
- Baidu has struggled for widespread adoption despite being an early competitor to ChatGPT.
- Plans for a next generation model, Ernie 5, are underway with multimodal improvements.
